EmoteActions.Message: This is a good find, however I can do nothing with such a flawed product. Now if you could find a whole mask, then I could work wonders with it ...
I think I can actually use this material to make a great masterpiece! Oh, it's broken ... Never mind.
I think I can actually use this material to make a great masterpiece! Oh, it's broken ... Never mind.
Hmm ... I think that this would make a fine piece were it not broken. If you can find a way to fix this I might be able to enhance it with another version of my artistic rendition of Pwyll.
Or you could give this to my apprentice after you have it fixed. He'll restore it to be more like the Virindi that it was taken from.
This would make a fine headpiece were it not broken. If you can find a way to fix this I might be able to craft it into something special.
No thank you, I've broken more than my share of tools on the hard carapace of those critters. Here, go see the Olthoi hunter in Arwic -- he can help you out.
What is it you expect from me? I carve heads, not pumpkins!
What do you expect me to make with this? It's an eye patch, not a mask.

A find worthy of crafting into a robe! But you still require another arm, two legs and a torso. You should be able to assemble those together without my aid. But only a master such as myself would be able to craft such objects into a fully wearable outfit.

A find worthy of crafting into a robe! But you still require another leg, two arms and a torso. You should be able to assemble those together without my aid. But only a master such as myself would be able to craft such objects into a fully wearable outfit.

What a fine mask! Such well-preserved fur!
You know, I really hate these creatures.
HA! HA! HA! HA! HA! HA! HA! HA! HA!
Oh, that's funny.
Wonderful craftsmanship! We mask makers are a crafty lot!
I hear Elysa holds the most wonderful costume parties. You should wear this if you're ever lucky enough to receive an invitation!
Think of the havoc you could cause in the marketplace!
Do you smell that? This thing stinks!
This is a rare find. This metal is extraordinary. I believe I can truly make something special out of this. Here, take this, and wear it with pride!
Wow I think I out did myself on this one. Maybe I should take a break ...
Excellent. Let me have a moment or two to craft the pieces needed to complete this mask. There! A little touch here and there, and it's finished.
Pwyll's Guard. Wear it with pride. And remember to tell people where you had it crafted!
Excellent. Let me have a moment or two to craft the pieces needed to complete this mask. There! A little touch here and there, and it's finished.
Pwyll's Guard. Wear it with pride. And remember to tell people where you had it crafted!
Excellent! Give me a moment here ...
Although you watch closely, the mask maker's hands move too quickly and skillfully to follow.

I decided to change the heroic theme of my past endeavors. Instead I have crafted a likeness of one of the most feared villains in Aluvian History. This helm represents the helm worn by Lord Alfric of Viamont as he stormed the shores of Aluvia in his warships. Clad in the Bull's visage, he laid waste to proud Aluvia and drove our people into the wilderness.
There! It's finished.
What a foul creature this is! However, I will not be deterred! I will make the finest of masks from it!
Undead always make me uneasy. If you really want a mask, that's fine, but if you ask me, it's eerie.
Tuskers are very scary foes. But they aren't so scary with their heads cut off!
This head reminds me of my poor departed grandmother. Poor Grandma ...
Wow, this one is pretty frightening. Ursuin remind me a lot of Mattekars, just not as pathetic.
My girlfriend is afraid of snakes. Maybe I should get a mask like that one and wear home to her tonight?
What is this thing? It certainly isn't a monster head! Hrm, it's transparent on the inside ... Ahah! I turned it inside out! Here you go.
Here you go, a new version of the Mosswart Mask.
Here you go, a new version of the Banderling Mask.
I wish I had one of these when I was a kid.
Hahaha, your kidding right?
Oh, I see you're a chicken lover. Well in that case you'll love this hat.
TurnedInHeadHollowMinion@Again
TurnedInHeadHollowMinion
You seriously want a mask made from this thing?
Well ok...

What's that? A mask isn't good enough for you? How 'bout this?!?
What's that? A mask isn't good enough for you? How 'bout this?!?
What's that? A mask isn't good enough for you? How 'bout this?!?
What's that? A mask isn't good enough for you? How 'bout this?!?
What's that? A mask isn't good enough for you? How 'bout this?!?
Masks are pretty useless. I'm just doing this while I go to school. I can make bags out of tusker heads too. Here you go!
Masks are pretty useless. I'm just doing this while I go to school. I can make bags out of tusker heads too. Here you go!
Masks are pretty useless. I'm just doing this while I go to school. I can make bags out of tusker heads too. Here you go!
Give me a moment and I will craft a fine costume for you from this body.

I've always had a soft spot in my heart for mites.
They taste great with a little tarragon and melted butter. You wouldn't happen to have carved off any meat when you obtained this head, would you? No? Ah well.
They wait thousands of years to seek vengeance for who knows what ancient crime, and what happens when they finally arrive on Dereth? Some tiny Isparian lops off their head! I love it!
Ridiculous creatures, these chitticks. But they're great in a stew!
They wait thousands of years to seek vengeance for who knows what ancient crime, and what happens when they finally arrive on Dereth? Some tiny Isparian lops off their head! I love it!
You'll be the belle of the ball with this fine costume!
I just learned how to make this costume. I must say, I am most impressed with myself!
Now, this is one fine costume. Go forth and scare some new arrivals!

Hello, I am Alexander the Deft. If you give me a creature's head or facial covering, I may be able to make it into a mask for you. If you would like an older version of the Mosswart or Banderling please hand those heads to my apprentice.
In times far past, many knights emblazoned the image of High King Pwyll on their helmets in order to show others that they fought in his name.
Heh, I bet you're wondering what a handsome guy like me is doing up here in Eastham. Well, this town is better than that Ayan Baqur place! I heard they have a Virindi there!
Hey, you already turned one of these in to me. Let's finish the first one before we make a second mask.
Yes! That's what I need. Ok, here, try this on.
TurnedInHeadHollowMinion
I have a great idea! Go and find me a Scarecrow Head.
TurnedInHeadHollowMinion
Hrmph. This is already a mask, more or less. Wear it with pride! On second thought, don't.
